description: Part three, part four, part five, part six-storey building with two basement levels to form a fifty-nine room, fifty-nine person co-living property (Use Class Sui Generis); and associated amenity, cycle parking, waste storage, and vehicle parking spaces (following demolition of existing buildings)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason:  In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (As Amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the drawings and documents numbered/titled:
Drawings
-	THP02-MAA-ZZ-DR-A-00001 Rev. P01;
-	THP02-MAA-ZZ-DR-A-00002 Rev. P01;
-	THP02-MAA-ZZ-DR-A-00003 Rev. P01;
-	THP02-MAA-ZZ-DR-A-00005 Rev. P01;
-	THP02-MAA-ZZ-DR-A-01001 Rev. P03;
-	THP02-MAA-ZZ-DR-A-02001 Rev. P08;
-	THP02-MAA-ZZ-DR-A-02002 Rev. P07;
-	THP02-MAA-ZZ-DR-A-02003 Rev. P06;
-	THP02-MAA-ZZ-DR-A-02004 Rev. P06;
-	THP02-MAA-ZZ-DR-A-02005 Rev. P01;
-	THP02-MAA-ZZ-DR-A-04001 Rev. P04;
-	THP02-MAA-ZZ-DR-A-04002 Rev. P04;
-	THP02-MAA-ZZ-DR-A-05001 Rev. P03; and
-	THP02-MAA-ZZ-DR-A-05002 Rev. P01.
Documents
-	Air Quality Assessment -- Prepared by Hawkins Environmental (04.06.2020);
-	Arboricultural Impact Assessment (ref. 010387) -- Prepared by Crown Tree Consultancy (21.10.2020);
-	Construction Method Statement -- Prepared by Knapp Hicks and Partners Limited (May 2020); Design & Access Statement -- Prepared by MAA Architects (May 2020);
-	Design & Access Statement (Page 24) -- Prepared & Amended by MAA Architects (23.10.2020);
-	Drainage Strategy Report (ref. DSR/001) -- Prepared by G30 Consulting (05.06.2020);
-	Dusk Emergence and Dawn Re-Entry Bat Survey (ref. RT-MME-152782) -- Prepared by Middlemarch Environmental (July 2020);
-	Landscape Strategy and Design Statement Rev. B -- Prepared by Landscape Connection (November 2020);
-	Noise Assessment (ref. 0436.1) -- Prepared by DKN Acoustics (November 2020);
-	Operational Management Plan -- Prepared by Urban Living (Received 13.05.2021);
-	Outline Construction Management Plan -- Prepared by Paul Mew Associates (June 2020);
-	Outline Fire Strategy Report Rev. 01 (ref. 10718BB) -- Prepared by Hogarth Property Group (08.10.2020);
-	Phase 1 Geoenvironmental Desk Study Report (ref. 36825/R/001/RJM) -- Prepared by Knapp Hicks and Partners;
-	Planning Statement -- Prepared by Maven Plan (June 2020);
-	Preliminary Bat Roost Assessment (ref. RT-MME-152614-02) -- Prepared by Middlemarch Environmental (June 2020);
-	Preliminary Ecology Appraisal (ref. RT-MME-152614-01) -- Prepared by Middlemarch Environmental (June 2020);
-	Schedule of Accommodation (THP02-MAA-SA-A-F100-00001 Rev. P05) -- Prepared by MAA Architects;
-	Sunlight Daylight and Overshadowing Assessment -- Prepared by Hawkins Environmental (18.12.2020);
-	Sustainability and Energy Statement -- Prepared by Maven Sustainability (27 May 2021);
-	Townscape & Visual Impact Assessment (Part 01) -- Prepared by Waterman Infrastructure & Environment Ltd. (December 2020);
-	Townscape & Visual Impact Assessment (Part 02) -- Prepared by Waterman Infrastructure & Environment Ltd. (December 2020);
-	Transport Statement -- Prepared by Paul Mew Associates (June 2020);
-	Transport Statement (Addendum 01) -- Prepared by Paul Mew Associates (October 2020);
-	Transport Statement (Addendum 02) -- Prepared by Paul Mew Associates (November 2020);
-	Tree Constraints Plan (ref. 10387) -- Prepared by Crown Tree Consultancy (21.20.2021); and
-	Urban Greening Factor Calculations (Received 11.05.2021).
Reason:   For avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning.

| Prior to construction of the visible superstructure of the buildings hereby approved, details of the materials to be used for the external surfaces and finishing of all buildings and structures of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. This condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters that have been given in this application. Development shall be carried out only in accordance with the approved details and, thereafter, permanently retained and maintained.

Reason:   To ensure that the materials harmonise with the neighbouring buildings and surrounding area in accordance with Section 12 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2019) and policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021); 1.1 and 1.2 of the Local Development Framework (Core) Strategy (2012); and 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013).
| The co-living scheme shall be limited to no more than fifty-nine (59) rooms with each bedroom being limited a single-occupant room and occupied by no more than one (1) occupant.

Reason:   To protect the living conditions of occupants of the co-living scheme and nearby properties in accordance with policies D4, D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021); and 7A, 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | The development hereby approved shall be used as a co-living scheme and for no other purpose or any use cited in any provision of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (As Amended) (or any subsequent order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modifications) relevant to uses falling within Use Class Sui Generis.

Reason:  To ensure that the Council retains control over the quality, impacts and provision of any change of use thereby safeguarding amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring properties and transport capacity in accordance with policies GC2, D14, T4 and T7 of the London Plan (2021); 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2026 (2012); and 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).

| Prior to any piling taking place on the development, a Piling Method Statement shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority in consultation with Thames Water. The statement must detail: the depth and type of piling to be undertaken, the methodology by the piling will be carried out (incl. measures to prevent and minimise the potential for damage to subsurface sewerage infrastructure), and the programme for the piling works. Any piling taking place on the development site must be undertaken in strict accordance with the approved Piling Method Statement.
Reason:   To safeguard the underground sewerage utility infrastructure located in close proximity to the proposed works.

| Prior to the commencement of any construction, demolition and excavation works, an updated copy of the Outline Construction Management Plan (June 2020) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The plan must detail the:
-	Methods for and phasing of all construction, demolition and excavation works (incl. key dates);
-	Site security;
-	Consolidated or re-timed trips;
-	On-site construction worker parking;
-	Compliance with the Non-Road Mobile Machinery Low Emissions Zone;
-	Abnormal load delivery vehicle routes and dates of these deliveries are also required:
-	Use of Transport for London's Freight Operator Recognition Scheme (FORS) or similar;
-	Site access for construction traffic and contractor staff parking and associated signage;
-	Anticipated number, frequency and size of construction vehicles entering/exiting the site;
-	Secure, off-street loading and drop-off facilities (incl. construction lorry sign-in programme);
-	Locations for the contractors' offices and storage of building materials and construction debris;
-	Delivery times and booking system (staggered to avoid morning and afternoon school run peak periods);
-	Construction vehicle routes limited to main distributor roads (A40 and A406) to prevent the use of residential roads and prohibit right turns in to and out of the site;
-	Vehicle manoeuvring and turning, including swept path diagrams to demonstrate how vehicles will access the site and be able to turn into and emerge from the site in forward gear;
-	Site specific investigation and risk management strategy for the basement excavation covering drainage, flood risk from all sources, land and structural stability, and local ground conditions;

-	Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents including the name, telephone number and address of a responsible person to whom enquiries / complaints should be directed. These contact details shall also be displayed at regular intervals around the site compound; and

-	Control measures for dust, noise, vibration, lighting, delivery locations, restriction of hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary to 08:00-18:00hrs Mondays to Fridays and 08:00-13:00 hrs on Saturdays - in accordance with the GLA's SPG for The Control of Dust and Emissions During Construction and Demolition (2014), ILP's Guidance Notes 1 for the Reduction of Obtrusive Light (2020), BS 5228-1:2009+A1:2014, and BS 5228-2:2009+A1:2014 - and the advance notification to neighbours and other interested parties of proposed works.
The development shall be carried out in strict accordance with the approved plan for the duration of the works.

Reason:   To protect the amenity of local residents and ensure adequate highway and site safety in accordance with policies D6, D11, D14, SI1, S12, T1, T2, T4 and T5 of the London Plan (2021); 1.1(e)(j) and 2.1(c) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013); the Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006); and BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise.

| Prior to their first use, all machinery / plant / equipment / extraction / ventilation systems and ducting for the development hereby approved shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and all fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced. These anti-vibration measures must be implemented prior to the first use of the machinery / plant / equipment / extraction / ventilation systems and ducting and, thereafter, retained and maintained for the life of the development.

Reason:  To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the co-living scheme and surrounding premises is not adversely affected by vibration noise, in accordance with policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021); and 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013).

| Prior to the commencement of development (incl. demolition and site clearance), details of an Air Quality and Dust Management Plan (AQDMP) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The AQDMP shall be produced in accordance with the GLA's SPG on The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition (2014) for the existing site and proposed development. Details must also be provided on a scheme for air pollution mitigation measures based on the find of the AQDMP. The development shall be carried out in strict accordance with the approved plan for the duration of the works.

Reason:  To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the co-living scheme and surrounding premises is not adversely affected by air pollution, in accordance with policies D6 and SI1 of the London Plan (2021); and 7A of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013).

| Prior to the commencement of works on the superstructure of the building hereby approved, details of a scheme providing fresh air ventilation to habitable rooms fronting onto Hanger Lane shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved mitigation scheme shall be fully implemented prior to the first occupation of the building and, thereafter, be retained and maintained for the life of the development.

Reason:  To ensure that future occupiers of the co-living scheme are not adversely affected by air pollution from the adjoining transport corridor in accordance with policies D6 and SI1 of the London Plan (2021).

| Prior to the commencement of works on the superstructure of the building hereby approved, details on Enhanced Sound Insulation shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details must demonstrate an enhanced sound insulation value of at least 5dB above the Building Regulations value for residential use of the floor/ceiling/walls separating bedrooms from the basement gym, plant room, social/cinema/communal rooms, laundry room, cycle storage, lifts, and/or communal entrances/staircases. Where noise emissions include characteristic features, the Noise Rating level should not exceed NR25 Leq 5mins (octaves) or NR20 Leq 5mins (1/3 octaves) inside a bedroom between the hours of 22:00 and 08:00. The submitted details must also include the installation method and materials of separating structures and, where necessary, additional mitigation measures and the resulting sound insulation value and internal sound level. All assessments completed and mitigation measures implemented shall be based on standards of the Ealing's Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 - Noise and Vibration and the criteria of BS8233:2014. The approved details shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of the building and, thereafter, be retained and maintained for the life of the development.

Reason:  To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the co-living scheme is not adversely affected by noise from adjoining communal areas in accordance with policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021); and 7A of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013).

| The individual and combined external noise level emitted from plant, machinery or equipment at the development site shall be lower than the lowest existing background noise level by at least 10dBA as measured at or calculated to the nearest and most affected noise sensitive premises. The assessment shall be completed in accordance with BS4142:2014 (e.g. ensuring all machinery operating together at maximum capacity).

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the approved development and surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/equipment, in accordance with policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021); and 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013).

| Prior to the commencement of works on the superstructure of the building hereby approved, details of a Noise Assessment of the sound insulation of the building envelope required to achieve the Local Planning Authority's (LPA) standards and noise limits specified BS8233:2014 shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the LPA. The Noise Assessment must be completed in accordance with the LPA's assessment standard as detailed in Ealing's Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 - Noise and Vibration including having regard to aircraft noise (worst mode aircraft 1-day noise contour predicted for 2016 (57dB)). The submitted details shall also include the glazing specifications (laboratory tested including frames, seals and any integral ventilators, approved in accordance with BS EN ISO 10140-2:2010) and acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building or suitably filtered and details of self-noise) necessary to achieve the LPA's standards and noise limits specified in BS8233:2014. The approved details shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of the building and, thereafter, be retained and maintained for the life of the development.

Reason:   To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the co-living scheme is not adversely affected by noise from commercial, cultural, industrial and transport sources, in accordance with Ealing's Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 - Noise and Vibration and policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021); and 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013).

| Prior to the commencement of works on the superstructure of the building hereby approved, details of all proprietary anti-vibration mounts, floor treatments and/or other mitigation measures for the isolation of equipment/walls/floors and loudspeakers from structures connected to bedrooms within the building shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the LPA. The mitigation measures and assessment of their effectiveness shall be based on the standards detailed in Ealing's Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 - Noise and Vibration and the criteria established within BS8233:2014. Approved details must be installed/implemented prior to the first occupation of the building and, thereafter, be retained and maintained for the life of the development.

Reason:   To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the co-living scheme is not adversely affected by vibration noise, in accordance with policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021); and 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013).

| The development shall be implemented in strict accordance with all ten (10) recommendations on mitigation, protection and new habitat creation for bats detailed in Sections 7 of the Preliminary Bat Roost Assessment (ref. RT-MME-152614-02) dated June 2020 and Dusk Emergence and Dawn Re-Entry Bat Survey (ref. RT-MME-152782) -- Prepared by Middlemarch Environmental (July 2020).

Construction of the development must take place in strict accordance with all ten (10) recommendations while any new habitat creation and bat boxes must be installed prior to the first occupation of the building and, thereafter, be retained and maintained for the life of the development.

Reason:   In the interest of protecting the ecological value of the site in accordance with policies G6 of the London Plan (2021); 1.1, 1.2 and 5.4 of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy (2012); and 2.18 of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013).

| Prior to the completion of the construction and occupation of the development, the development shall implement and maintain, and in the case of energy generation equipment confirm as operational, the approved measures to achieve an overall sitewide reduction in regulated CO2 emissions of at least 41.06% (equating to 14.12 tonnes of CO2 per year) beyond Building Regulations Part L 2013. These CO2 savings shall be achieved through the Lean, Clean, Green Energy Hierarchy as detailed in the approved Sustainability & Energy Statement -- Prepared by Maven Sustainability (27 May 2021).

a)	Prior to commencement of construction of the development, details of the specifications including manufacturers performance data sheets, design, and layout of the proposed low and zero-carbon (LZC) energy equipment, and the associated monitoring devices required to identify their performance/efficiency (COP) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall be implemented only in accordance with the approved details.

b)	Prior to the installation of the renewable/low-carbon energy equipment, technical details of the equipment shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall include the exact heat pump thermal kilowatt output, heat output pipe diameter(s), parasitic load supply schematics, monthly energy demand profile, and the exact number of PV arrays, the kWp capacity of each array, the orientation, pitch and mounting of the panels, and the make and model of the panels. The name and contact details of the LZC installation contractor(s), and, if different, the commissioning electrical or plumbing contractor, should be submitted to the Council prior to installation.

c)	All boilers to serve the energy requirements of the development detailed in the approved energy strategy should be specified with NOx emissions (g/m²) that are compliant with or better than the ultra-low NOx (g/m²) benchmarks as set out at Appendix 5 of the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG.

d)	Within three (3) months of the occupation of the development, the relevant Energy Performance Certificate (EPC) and detailed SAP Worksheets showing clearly the TER and DER from the 'as built stage' following completion of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority in order to confirm compliance with the energy efficiency measures detailed in the approved Energy Strategy. The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the approved details.

Reason:   In the interest of addressing climate change and securing environmentally sustainable development in accordance with policies SI2 and SI3 of the London Plan (2021); 1.1 and 1.2 of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy (2012); and 5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013), and Guidance Note 11 of the GLA Energy Assessment Guidance (2018).

| Prior to the first occupation and the co-living scheme and commencement of landscaping works for the development, full details of the landscaping proposals shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. These details shall include but are not limited to:

-	Details of the green roofs and green living walls shown in the Proposed Plans and Elevations listed in Condition 2 including the type of plant(s), mounting system, and irrigation and draining system to be used/installed, as well as, maintenance plans for green living roofs and walls for the life of the development;

-	Details of hard and soft landscaping, boundary treatments and outdoor furniture palette including not just materials and heights but also specifications, colour schemes and how these would work with the associated building materials palette;

-	Details on the complete delivery of all seven (7) recommendations described in Section of the Preliminary Ecology Appraisal (ref. RT-MME-152614-01) -- Prepared by Middlemarch Environmental (June 2020);

-	Details on the complete delivery of all three (3) recommendations described in Section of the Preliminary Bat Roost Assessment (ref. RT-MME-152614-02) -- Prepared by Middlemarch Environmental (June 2020);
-	Details of all soft landscaping and a planting palette including species and mixes for trees, shrubs, perennials, bulbs, grass and wildflower meadows;
-	Details of a Landscape Management Plan for a minimum period of five (5) years from the implementation of final planting; and
-	Full planting schedule of tree sizes, species, number of trees and locations.
| Upon the completion of the construction of the development but prior to its first occupation:

A)	Suitable devices for monitoring the performance of the photovoltaic (PV) panels shall be installed. The monitored data shall be automatically submitted to the Council at daily intervals for a period of four (4) years from occupation and full operation of the energy equipment. The installation of the monitoring devices and the submission and format of the data shall be carried out in accordance with the Council's approved specifications as indicated in the Automated Energy Monitoring Platform (AEMP) information document. The developer must contact the Council's chosen AEMP supplier (Energence Ltd.) on commencement of construction to facilitate the monitoring process; and

B)	The Developer/Appellant must submit to the Council proof of a contractual arrangement with a certified contractor that provides for the ongoing, commissioning, maintenance, and repair of the renewable/low-carbon energy equipment for a period of three (3) years from the point that the building is occupied and the equipment fully operational.

Reason:  To monitor the effectiveness and continued operation of the renewable/low carbon energy equipment in order to confirm compliance with energy policies and establish an in-situ evidence base on the performance of such equipment in accordance with policies SI2 of the London Plan (2021); 5.2 of Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); and 2.5.36 of the Mayor's Sustainable Design & Construction SPG.

| Prior to the commencement of development (aside from demolition and site clearance), details of drainage designs and an Ealing version of a London Sustainable Drainage Proforma confirming the disposal of surface water at greenfield run-off rates and in accordance with the submitted Drainage Strategy Report (ref. DSR/001) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority in consultation with the sewerage undertaker. The details must include:
-	Any on and/or off-site drainage works necessary;
-	Proposal to promote benefits including biodiversity, amenity, water quality and attenuation;
-	Surface water attenuation systems designed to accommodate the 1 in 100 years plus 40% climate change storm event; and
-	A detailed maintenance plan of the proposed drainage system for the lifetime of the development confirming owners/adopters of the drainage system.
The approved details must be implemented prior to the commencement of the development and, thereafter, retained and maintained for the life of the development.

Reason:  To reduce the risk of the flooding of the application property, neighbouring properties, and local area in accordance with policies SI12 and SI13 of the London Plan (2021); 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); and 5.12 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | Prior to the commencement of any construction, demolition and excavation works, a tree and root protection plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The plan must be completed in accordance with the most recent revision of BS5837 and detail all methods of protection including but not limited to locations of construction exclusion zones, root protection areas, fit for purpose fencing and ground protection, service routes, works access space, material/machinery/waste storage, and permanent and temporary hard surfaces.

Reason:  To safeguard existing trees in the interests of protecting the visual amenity of the local area and retaining existing urban greening in accordance with Ealing's SPG 9 - Trees and Development Guidelines, as well as, policies D4, G5, G7, SI1 and SI2 of the London Plan (2021); and 5.10, 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013).

| Prior to the first occupation of the dwelling units of the development, details on the installation of ultra-low NOx boiler with maximum NOx emissions of less than 0.030 g/kWh in each dwelling unit shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved details must be implemented prior to the first occupation of the dwelling units and, thereafter, retained and maintained for the life of the development.
Reason:  To ensure that local air quality is not reduced by the development, in accordance with policies SI1 of the London Plan (2021); and 7A of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013).

| The indoor gym space to be provided within the development shall be designed, managed, monitored and maintained in accordance with Sport England's Active Design principles including being fully accessible. Furthermore, the indoor gym space must be made ready and fully operational prior to the first occupation of the building and, thereafter, be retained, maintained and monitored for the life of the development.

Reason:   To enable all future occupiers of the co-living scheme to engage in a healthy and active lifestyle by providing an opportunity for activity inside the building in accordance with Sport England's Active Design principles and policies GG3, D5, D7 and S5 of the London Plan (2021).

| A minimum of two (2) short-stay cycle parking spaces and forty-eight (48) secured and covered long-stay cycle storage spaces shall be provided in the forecourt of the property and cycle storeroom respectively as shown in dwgs. THP02-MAA-ZZ-DR-A-01001 Rev. P03 and THP02-MAA-ZZ-DR-A-02001 Rev. P08 of Condition 2. Additionally, details on an additional provision of a minimum of eleven (11) secured and covered long-stay cycle storage space within the curtilage of the property shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Such provisions shall be provided in accordance with standards adopted by Policy T5 of the London Plan (2021), brought into use prior to first occupation of the co-living scheme, and, thereafter, retained and maintained for the life of the development
Reason:   To provide adequate facilities for cyclists and increase the use of active and sustainable modes of transport, in accordance with policies T1, T2, T4, and T5 of the London Plan (2021).

| Prior to the first occupation of the co-living scheme and commencement of any landscaping works, details of a scheme to reinstate the single existing crossover to the front of the property as a level public footpath and form a new crossover with raised table and appropriate paving materials to guide the partially sighted pedestrians shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved details must be implemented at the applicant's expense prior to the first occupation of the co-living scheme and, thereafter, retained and maintained for the life of the development.

Reason:   To improve the quality of the public realm and balance the space given to people to dwell, walk and cycle, as well as, ensure highway safety in accordance with policies T1, T2, T4, T6 and T6.1 of the London Plan (2021); and 6.13 of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013).

| Prior to the first occupation of any part of the development hereby approved, a Delivery, Servicing and Parking Management Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The plan must include details on:
-	Deliveries and collections including how deliveries will be scheduled to avoid several lorries arriving at the site simultaneously;
-	Servicing trips (including maintenance) and measures to reduce the number of freight trips to the site (freight consolidation);
-	Cleaning and waste removal including arrangements for refuse collection;
-	Assignment, design and management of vehicle parking spaces; and
-	Monitoring and review of operations.
The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the approved plan for the life of the development.

Reason:   To ensure that the development can be adequately serviced in the interests of the amenity of occupies of the development and neighbouring properties, local/regional strategies adopted to increase the use of sustainable modes of transport, and pedestrian and highway safety and movement, in accordance with policies D4, D6, D8, SI7, T1, T2, T4, T5, T6 and T6.1 of the London Plan (2021); and 7A of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013).

| Prior to the first occupation of the co-living scheme, a written and illustrated Waste Management Plan designed in accordance with BS 5906:2005 and Ealing Council's Waste Management Guidelines for Architects and Developers shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The plan must detail the:
-	Expected volume of waste (i.e. food, recycling, and refuse waste) from the groups of units;
-	Location of the various bins to be provided (incl. separate provisions and enclosures for the various groups of units); and
-	Proposed arrangements for the presentation, retrieval and/or collection of the bins on collection days.

The provisions described in the approved plan shall be brought into use prior to first occupation and retained permanently. Additionally, the collection day procedures shall be adhered to in accordance with the approved plan for the life of the development.

Reason:  In the interests of safeguarding public health, reducing and managing waste generated by the development, and keeping local highways clear of visual blight and impediments to movement in accordance with the Ealing Council's Waste Management Guidelines for Architects and Developers, as well as, policies D4, D6, D8, SI7, T1, T2, T4 and T5 of the London Plan (2021); 1.1 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013).

| Prior to the first occupation of the dwelling units of the development, an update the Travel Plan Statement contained within the approved Transport Statements and Addendums Prepared by Paul Mew Associates shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The updates to the plan must include:
-	One-Year, three-year and five-year targets set in both percentage and absolute figure;
-	Confirmation that failure to meet the identified targets will trigger a new five-year monitoring cycle;
-	Any proposed remedial measures/actions; and
-	Budget allocation to travel plan measures.
Reason:   To promote sustainable patterns of transport, safe
